react.title: React
react.desc: The world's most popular UI library for building fast, interactive, component-driven web applications with a virtual DOM.
react.longDesc:
React has fundamentally changed how we build web interfaces. Created by Meta and used by millions of developers worldwide, React's component-based architecture enables us to build complex UIs from small, isolated pieces of code that are easy to test, maintain, and reuse.

At DMC Kreatif, React is at the core of every project we deliver. Its virtual DOM ensures lightning-fast updates, while the massive ecosystem of libraries — from React Router for navigation to React Hook Form for data collection — means we never have to reinvent the wheel.

For European businesses, React offers a critical advantage: its server-side rendering capabilities (via Next.js) and code-splitting features deliver the performance that search engines demand. Combined with TypeScript for type safety, our React applications consistently achieve 95+ Lighthouse scores while remaining easy to maintain and extend as your business grows.
react.why1: Component-based architecture enables rapid development and effortless code reuse across projects
react.why2: Virtual DOM ensures blazing-fast UI updates with minimal browser re-renders
react.why3: Ecosystem of 2M+ npm packages means battle-tested solutions for every requirement
react.why4: Backed by Meta with 220K+ GitHub stars and the largest developer community worldwide
react.f2: Virtual DOM for optimal rendering performance
react.f3: React Hooks for clean state management
react.f5: Code splitting and lazy loading built-in
react.f7: Concurrent rendering for smooth user experiences
react.f8: Massive ecosystem of UI libraries and tools
react.altVueDesc: Progressive JavaScript framework with an approachable learning curve and excellent documentation
react.altVuePros: Gentle learning curve, great docs, reactive data binding, single-file components
react.altVueCons: Smaller enterprise ecosystem, fewer job listings, less third-party library support
react.altAngularDesc: Full-featured MVC framework by Google with built-in dependency injection and TypeScript
react.altAngularPros: Complete solution out of the box, TypeScript-first, strong enterprise adoption
react.altAngularCons: Steeper learning curve, heavier bundle size, more boilerplate code required

nextjs.title: Next.js
nextjs.desc: The full-stack React framework for production-grade web applications with built-in SSR, SSG, and API routes.
nextjs.longDesc:
Next.js by Vercel has become the gold standard for building production React applications. It extends React with powerful features like server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), and incremental static regeneration (ISR) — all crucial for SEO and performance.

We choose Next.js for projects where search engine visibility is paramount. Its file-based routing, automatic code splitting, and image optimisation deliver exceptional Core Web Vitals scores out of the box. The App Router introduced in Next.js 13+ brings React Server Components, reducing client-side JavaScript dramatically.

For multilingual European businesses, Next.js offers built-in internationalisation (i18n) routing, making it straightforward to serve content in English, French, Dutch, and German from a single codebase. Combined with Vercel's edge network, your site loads in under a second from anywhere in Europe.
nextjs.why1: Built-in SSR and SSG deliver exceptional SEO performance for European markets
nextjs.why2: Automatic code splitting reduces initial load by up to 70% compared to SPAs
nextjs.why3: Native i18n routing makes multilingual sites effortless across EN, FR, NL, DE
nextjs.why4: Vercel edge deployment ensures sub-second load times across all of Europe
nextjs.f1: Server-side rendering for instant page loads
nextjs.f2: Static site generation for maximum performance
nextjs.altGatsbyDesc: Static site generator built on React with a rich plugin ecosystem and GraphQL data layer
nextjs.altGatsbyPros: Excellent for content sites, huge plugin library, GraphQL data layer
nextjs.altGatsbyCons: Slow builds at scale, limited SSR, declining community momentum
nextjs.altRemixDesc: Full-stack web framework focused on web standards and progressive enhancement
nextjs.altRemixPros: Excellent data loading patterns, progressive enhancement, web standards-first
nextjs.altRemixCons: Smaller ecosystem, fewer hosting options, newer community

typescript.title: TypeScript
typescript.desc: JavaScript with static type checking that catches bugs before they reach production, improving code quality and developer productivity.
typescript.longDesc:
TypeScript adds static type checking to JavaScript, catching entire categories of bugs at compile time rather than in production. For European businesses where reliability is non-negotiable, TypeScript is our insurance policy against runtime errors.

Every project at DMC Kreatif uses TypeScript in strict mode. This means every variable, function parameter, and return value has an explicit type, making our codebase self-documenting and significantly easier to maintain. When we hand over a project, your development team can understand the code instantly.

TypeScript's integration with modern IDEs provides intelligent autocomplete, inline documentation, and automated refactoring that dramatically speeds up development. The result is fewer bugs, faster delivery, and code that remains maintainable for years to come.
typescript.why1: Catches 15-20% of bugs at compile time before they ever reach production
typescript.why2: Self-documenting code with explicit types makes handover and maintenance effortless
typescript.why3: IDE integration provides intelligent autocomplete and automated refactoring
typescript.why4: Industry standard adopted by 78% of JavaScript developers for production apps
typescript.f1: Static type checking catches bugs early
typescript.f2: Interface and type definitions for APIs
typescript.f6: Strict null checks prevent runtime errors
typescript.altJsDesc: The original dynamic scripting language of the web with no type system overhead
typescript.altJsPros: No compilation step, zero learning curve for web devs, maximum flexibility
typescript.altJsCons: No type safety, runtime errors in production, harder to refactor at scale
typescript.altFlowDesc: Static type checker for JavaScript by Meta with gradual typing support
typescript.altFlowPros: Gradual adoption, good React integration, sound type system
typescript.altFlowCons: Declining community, fewer IDE integrations, limited library support

vite.title: Vite
vite.desc: Next-generation build tool with instant hot module replacement and optimised production builds powered by Rollup.
vite.longDesc:
Vite has revolutionised the JavaScript build tool landscape. Created by Evan You (the creator of Vue.js), Vite leverages native ES modules in the browser during development, delivering instant server start and lightning-fast hot module replacement (HMR) regardless of application size.

At DMC Kreatif, Vite is our default build tool for all React projects that don't require Next.js. Its development experience is unmatched — changes appear in the browser in under 50ms, making the feedback loop nearly instantaneous. For production, Vite uses Rollup under the hood, producing highly optimised bundles with automatic code splitting.

Vite's plugin ecosystem is fully compatible with Rollup plugins, giving us access to thousands of battle-tested tools. Combined with its first-class TypeScript and CSS Modules support, Vite delivers the perfect balance of developer experience and production performance.
vite.why1: Instant server start and sub-50ms HMR make development 10x faster than Webpack
vite.why2: Rollup-based production builds produce 30-40% smaller bundles than alternatives
vite.why3: First-class TypeScript, JSX, and CSS support with zero configuration
vite.why4: Framework-agnostic with excellent React, Vue, and Svelte integration
vite.altWebpackDesc: Industry-standard module bundler with the largest ecosystem and extensive configuration
vite.altWebpackPros: Massive ecosystem, extensive loader system, proven at enterprise scale
vite.altWebpackCons: Slow dev server start, complex configuration, slower HMR at scale
vite.altParcelDesc: Zero-configuration build tool with automatic code splitting and transformation
vite.altParcelPros: True zero-config, automatic transformations, built-in dev server
vite.altParcelCons: Less control over output, smaller plugin ecosystem, less community support

tailwindcss.title: Tailwind CSS
tailwindcss.desc: Utility-first CSS framework for building custom designs rapidly without ever leaving your HTML, with built-in responsive design.
tailwindcss.longDesc:
Tailwind CSS fundamentally changed how we approach styling. Instead of writing custom CSS for every component, Tailwind provides low-level utility classes that compose into any design directly in your markup. The result is faster development, smaller CSS bundles, and designs that are trivially easy to maintain.

Every DMC Kreatif project uses Tailwind CSS with a custom design token system. Our colour palette, spacing scale, and typography are defined once in the Tailwind config, ensuring pixel-perfect consistency across every page. The JIT (Just-In-Time) compiler generates only the CSS you actually use, keeping bundles under 10KB.

For responsive design, Tailwind's mobile-first breakpoint system makes it effortless to create layouts that look stunning on every device. Combined with Tailwind's dark mode utilities and our neo-brutalist design system, we deliver unique, branded experiences that stand out from generic templates.
tailwindcss.why1: Utility-first approach reduces CSS bundle size by 80-95% compared to traditional frameworks
tailwindcss.why2: Custom design tokens ensure pixel-perfect brand consistency across all pages
tailwindcss.why3: Mobile-first responsive breakpoints make every site look perfect on every device
tailwindcss.why4: JIT compiler generates only used CSS, keeping production stylesheets under 10KB
tailwindcss.altBootstrapDesc: Popular component framework with pre-built UI elements and a grid system
tailwindcss.altBootstrapPros: Pre-built components, familiar grid system, extensive documentation
tailwindcss.altBootstrapCons: Generic look without heavy customisation, larger bundle, opinionated design
tailwindcss.altCssModulesDesc: Scoped CSS with automatic class name hashing for component-level encapsulation
tailwindcss.altCssModulesPros: True scope isolation, no naming conflicts, works with any CSS
tailwindcss.altCssModulesCons: Requires separate CSS files, no utility classes, more verbose styling

framer-motion.title: Framer Motion
framer-motion.desc: Production-ready React animation library with declarative syntax, gesture support, and layout animations.
framer-motion.longDesc:
Framer Motion is the most powerful animation library in the React ecosystem. It provides a declarative API that makes complex animations simple — from scroll-triggered reveals and page transitions to gesture-driven interactions and layout animations.

At DMC Kreatif, animations are not decorative — they communicate. Every scroll reveal, hover effect, and page transition is carefully orchestrated to guide users through the content hierarchy. Framer Motion's variants system lets us define animation states declaratively, keeping our code clean and maintainable.

The library's performance is exceptional. Framer Motion uses hardware-accelerated CSS transforms by default, animates at 60fps on mobile devices, and supports the Web Animations API for maximum efficiency. Its AnimatePresence component handles exit animations gracefully, something that's notoriously difficult with CSS alone.
framer-motion.why1: Declarative API makes complex animations simple to implement and maintain
framer-motion.why2: Hardware-accelerated transforms ensure 60fps animations even on mobile devices
framer-motion.why3: Variants system enables orchestrated, staggered animations with minimal code
framer-motion.why4: AnimatePresence handles exit animations that CSS alone cannot achieve
framer-motion.altGsapDesc: Professional-grade animation library with timeline control and advanced sequencing
framer-motion.altGsapPros: Most powerful animation engine, timeline control, ScrollTrigger plugin
framer-motion.altGsapCons: Not React-native, imperative API, commercial licence for some features
framer-motion.altCssDesc: Native browser animations using CSS keyframes, transitions, and transforms
framer-motion.altCssPros: Zero bundle cost, hardware accelerated, no JavaScript dependency
framer-motion.altCssCons: No exit animations, limited orchestration, cannot animate layout changes

supabase.title: Supabase
supabase.desc: Open-source Firebase alternative with PostgreSQL, real-time subscriptions, authentication, storage, and edge functions.
supabase.longDesc:
Supabase is our backend platform of choice. Built on top of PostgreSQL, it provides everything a modern web application needs: authentication, real-time subscriptions, file storage, edge functions, and a powerful auto-generated API — all without vendor lock-in.

For European businesses, Supabase offers a critical advantage: data can be hosted in EU regions, ensuring full GDPR compliance. Row-Level Security (RLS) policies let us implement fine-grained access control directly at the database level, meaning your data is protected even if application code has vulnerabilities.

Supabase's real-time capabilities enable features like live notifications, collaborative editing, and instant data synchronisation. Combined with its generous free tier and predictable pricing, Supabase is the ideal backend for startups and enterprises alike.
supabase.why1: PostgreSQL foundation ensures enterprise-grade reliability with zero vendor lock-in
supabase.why2: EU region hosting and Row-Level Security provide built-in GDPR compliance
supabase.why3: Real-time subscriptions enable live features without additional infrastructure
supabase.why4: Auto-generated REST and GraphQL APIs eliminate 80% of backend boilerplate
supabase.altFirebaseDesc: Google's app development platform with real-time database and hosting
supabase.altFirebasePros: Deep Google integration, extensive documentation, generous free tier
supabase.altFirebaseCons: NoSQL only, vendor lock-in, limited query capabilities, US-first infrastructure
supabase.altAmplifyDesc: AWS full-stack development platform with auth, API, storage, and hosting
supabase.altAmplifyPros: AWS ecosystem integration, GraphQL API, extensive AWS services access
supabase.altAmplifyCons: Complex pricing, steep learning curve, heavy CLI tooling

vercel.title: Vercel
vercel.desc: The platform for frontend developers, providing global edge deployment, serverless functions, and seamless Git integration.
vercel.longDesc:
Vercel is where our web applications live. As the creators of Next.js, Vercel provides the most optimised hosting platform for React and Next.js applications. Every deployment is distributed across their global edge network, ensuring sub-second load times from anywhere in Europe.

Our deployment workflow is fully automated: push to Git, and Vercel builds, tests, and deploys automatically. Every pull request gets its own preview URL for stakeholder review, and rollbacks are instant if anything goes wrong. This CI/CD pipeline means we can ship updates multiple times per day with zero risk.

Vercel's analytics provide real-time Core Web Vitals monitoring, so we can track performance metrics for every visitor. Combined with serverless functions for backend logic and edge middleware for authentication and redirects, Vercel is a complete platform — not just hosting.
vercel.why1: Global edge network delivers sub-second load times from 100+ points of presence
vercel.why2: Automatic CI/CD with preview deployments for every pull request
vercel.why3: Real-time Web Vitals analytics monitor performance for every visitor
vercel.why4: Created by the Next.js team, ensuring first-class framework support
vercel.altNetlifyDesc: Web hosting and automation platform with serverless functions and form handling
vercel.altNetlifyPros: Great DX, form handling built-in, split testing, identity service
vercel.altNetlifyCons: Slower edge propagation, less Next.js optimisation, fewer analytics
vercel.altAwsDesc: Amazon's cloud platform with S3, CloudFront, and Lambda for web hosting
vercel.altAwsPros: Unlimited scalability, full infrastructure control, comprehensive services
vercel.altAwsCons: Complex setup, unpredictable pricing, requires DevOps expertise

shopify.title: Shopify
shopify.desc: The leading e-commerce platform for building online stores with multi-currency, multi-language, and EU payment support.
shopify.longDesc:
Shopify powers over 4 million online stores worldwide, and for good reason. It provides everything a European e-commerce business needs: multi-currency checkout, multi-language storefronts, EU payment gateway support, and GDPR-compliant data handling — all without managing servers.

At DMC Kreatif, we build custom Shopify experiences using both Liquid themes for traditional storefronts and Hydrogen (Shopify's React framework) for headless commerce. This means your store can have the reliability of Shopify's backend with a fully custom, blazing-fast frontend.

Shopify's app ecosystem of 8,000+ apps handles everything from inventory management and shipping to email marketing and loyalty programmes. Combined with Shopify Payments for seamless checkout across Europe, it's the fastest path to a profitable online store.
shopify.why1: Multi-currency and multi-language built-in for pan-European e-commerce
shopify.why2: 99.99% uptime with PCI DSS compliance eliminates server management overhead
shopify.why3: Hydrogen framework enables headless commerce with custom React frontends
shopify.why4: 8,000+ app ecosystem covers every e-commerce requirement imaginable
shopify.altWooDesc: WordPress e-commerce plugin with full customisation and open-source flexibility
shopify.altWooPros: Open source, full customisation, huge plugin ecosystem, lower cost
shopify.altWooCons: Requires hosting management, security responsibility, slower performance
shopify.altMagentoDesc: Enterprise e-commerce platform (Adobe Commerce) for large-scale stores
shopify.altMagentoPros: Enterprise features, unlimited scalability, B2B capabilities
shopify.altMagentoCons: Very expensive, complex setup, requires dedicated development team

headless-wordpress.title: Headless WordPress
headless-wordpress.desc: WordPress as a headless CMS, combining familiar content management with modern React frontends for superior performance.
headless-wordpress.longDesc:
WordPress powers 43% of the web, and for good reason — its content management experience is unmatched. Headless WordPress separates the familiar WordPress admin from the frontend, letting us build blazing-fast React applications while your team manages content through the WordPress dashboard they already know.

This approach gives you the best of both worlds: content editors get the intuitive WordPress interface with its rich plugin ecosystem (ACF, Yoast SEO, WPML), while your visitors get a modern, performant frontend built with React and Next.js that scores 95+ on Lighthouse.

For European businesses migrating from traditional WordPress, the headless approach is the smoothest upgrade path. Your existing content, media library, and editorial workflows remain intact — only the frontend gets a modern overhaul. We use the WordPress REST API or WPGraphQL to connect the two layers seamlessly.
headless-wordpress.why1: Familiar WordPress CMS for content editors with zero learning curve
headless-wordpress.why2: React frontend delivers 3-5x faster page loads than traditional WordPress themes
headless-wordpress.why3: Existing WordPress plugins (ACF, Yoast, WPML) continue working as before
headless-wordpress.why4: Smoothest migration path for businesses currently on traditional WordPress
headless-wordpress.altStrapiDesc: Open-source headless CMS with a customisable admin panel and REST/GraphQL API
headless-wordpress.altStrapiPros: Modern tech stack, customisable admin, self-hosted, no licence fees
headless-wordpress.altStrapiCons: Smaller ecosystem, less content editor familiarity, fewer plugins
headless-wordpress.altContentfulDesc: Enterprise headless CMS with cloud-hosted content infrastructure and CDN delivery
headless-wordpress.altContentfulPros: Cloud-hosted, excellent CDN, rich API, enterprise-grade reliability
headless-wordpress.altContentfulCons: Expensive at scale, vendor lock-in, limited free tier

postgresql.title: PostgreSQL
postgresql.desc: The world's most advanced open-source relational database with JSONB, full-text search, and enterprise-grade reliability.
postgresql.longDesc:
PostgreSQL is the backbone of our backend infrastructure. As the world's most advanced open-source relational database, it offers features that rival commercial databases costing tens of thousands — JSONB for flexible document storage, full-text search, row-level security, and ACID compliance for bulletproof data integrity.

At DMC Kreatif, PostgreSQL powers every Supabase project we build. Its Row-Level Security (RLS) policies are essential for GDPR compliance, ensuring that users can only access their own data — enforced at the database level, not just the application layer. This defence-in-depth approach is critical for European businesses handling personal data.

PostgreSQL's performance at scale is exceptional. With proper indexing, it handles millions of rows with sub-millisecond query times. Its JSON support lets us store flexible, schema-less data alongside relational data, giving us the best of both SQL and NoSQL worlds.
postgresql.why1: ACID compliance and RLS provide bulletproof data integrity and GDPR-ready security
postgresql.why2: JSONB support combines relational and document storage in a single database
postgresql.why3: Full-text search eliminates the need for external search services like Elasticsearch
postgresql.why4: Zero licence costs with enterprise-grade features rivalling Oracle and SQL Server
postgresql.altMysqlDesc: Popular open-source relational database owned by Oracle with wide hosting support
postgresql.altMysqlPros: Simple to use, wide hosting support, good read performance, familiar to most devs
postgresql.altMysqlCons: Weaker JSON support, no RLS, less advanced features, Oracle ownership concerns
postgresql.altMongoDesc: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schemas and horizontal scaling
postgresql.altMongoPros: Flexible schemas, horizontal scaling, great for unstructured data
postgresql.altMongoCons: No ACID by default, no joins, eventual consistency issues, vendor lock-in risk

nodejs.title: Node.js
nodejs.desc: Server-side JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, enabling full-stack development with a single language.
nodejs.longDesc:
Node.js enables us to use JavaScript on the server, creating a unified development experience across the entire stack. Built on Chrome's V8 engine, Node.js delivers exceptional I/O performance thanks to its event-driven, non-blocking architecture — perfect for real-time applications, APIs, and microservices.

At DMC Kreatif, Node.js is the runtime that powers our serverless functions, API endpoints, and build tools. Its npm registry with over 2 million packages means we have a battle-tested solution for virtually any backend requirement. From authentication middleware to payment processing, the ecosystem is unmatched.

For European businesses, Node.js's lightweight footprint means lower infrastructure costs and faster cold starts on serverless platforms like Vercel and AWS Lambda. Its ability to handle thousands of concurrent connections with minimal resources makes it ideal for building scalable APIs that serve users across the continent.
nodejs.why1: Single language across frontend and backend reduces context switching and hiring costs
nodejs.why2: Event-driven I/O handles thousands of concurrent connections with minimal resources
nodejs.why3: 2M+ npm packages provide battle-tested solutions for every backend requirement
nodejs.why4: Lightweight runtime with fast cold starts is ideal for serverless and edge computing
nodejs.altDenoDesc: Secure JavaScript runtime by Node.js creator with built-in TypeScript and web APIs
nodejs.altDenoPros: Secure by default, built-in TypeScript, web-standard APIs, modern tooling
nodejs.altDenoCons: Smaller ecosystem, npm compatibility still maturing, fewer hosting options
nodejs.altPythonDesc: High-level programming language with extensive libraries for web, data, and ML
nodejs.altPythonPros: Rich data science ecosystem, readable syntax, Django/Flask frameworks
nodejs.altPythonCons: Slower execution, GIL limitations, separate frontend language needed

faq.react1Q: Why does DMC Kreatif use React for web development?
faq.react1A: React's component-based architecture and virtual DOM make it the ideal choice for building fast, scalable web applications. With 220K+ GitHub stars and millions of developers, React ensures long-term maintainability and access to the largest ecosystem of UI libraries.
faq.react2Q: Is React suitable for SEO-heavy websites?
faq.react2A: Yes — when paired with Next.js for server-side rendering. We use React with Next.js for SEO-critical projects, ensuring search engines can crawl and index all content while maintaining React's interactive capabilities.
faq.react3Q: How long does it take to build a React website?
faq.react3A: A typical React website takes 2-4 weeks depending on complexity. Simple landing pages can be delivered in under a week, while full-featured applications with authentication and dashboards take 4-8 weeks.
faq.react4Q: Can you migrate my existing website to React?
faq.react4A: Absolutely. We specialise in migrating websites from WordPress, jQuery, and legacy frameworks to modern React. Our phased migration approach ensures zero downtime and preserves your existing SEO rankings.
faq.react5Q: What is the cost of a React development project?
faq.react5A: React projects start from €497 for single-page applications. Multi-page sites with advanced features range from €997-€2,997. Contact us for a free consultation and custom quote tailored to your requirements.
faq.nextjs1Q: When should I choose Next.js over plain React?
faq.nextjs1A: Choose Next.js when SEO is critical, when you need server-side rendering, or when building a multilingual site. For pure single-page apps or client dashboards where SEO doesn't matter, Vite + React is faster and lighter.
faq.nextjs2Q: Does Next.js improve SEO compared to React?
faq.nextjs2A: Yes, significantly. Next.js's server-side rendering sends fully rendered HTML to search engines, while client-side React sends empty HTML. This leads to faster indexing, better rankings, and improved Core Web Vitals scores.
faq.nextjs3A: Next.js has built-in i18n routing that makes multilingual sites straightforward. We configure locale detection, URL prefixes (en, fr, nl, de), and alternate hreflang tags automatically for all European markets.
faq.nextjs4Q: What hosting does DMC Kreatif use for Next.js?
faq.nextjs4A: We deploy Next.js applications on Vercel, the platform built by the Next.js creators. This ensures optimal performance, automatic CI/CD, and a global edge network with 100+ points of presence across Europe.
faq.nextjs5Q: How does Next.js compare to WordPress for business websites?
faq.nextjs5A: Next.js delivers 3-5x faster page loads, perfect Lighthouse scores, and built-in security — no plugins, updates, or hack vulnerabilities. For businesses that need a CMS, we pair Next.js with headless WordPress for the best of both worlds.
faq.typescript1Q: Why do you use TypeScript instead of JavaScript?
faq.typescript1A: TypeScript catches 15-20% of bugs at compile time that would otherwise reach production. It makes code self-documenting, enables powerful IDE autocomplete, and is now the industry standard used by 78% of professional JavaScript developers.
faq.typescript2A: Initially there's a small overhead, but TypeScript pays for itself quickly. Fewer bugs mean less debugging time, better autocomplete means faster coding, and explicit types mean faster onboarding for new team members.
faq.typescript3Q: Can TypeScript work with my existing JavaScript code?
faq.typescript3A: Yes — TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript, so all valid JavaScript is valid TypeScript. We can migrate incrementally, adding types file by file, with zero disruption to your existing application.
faq.typescript4Q: Is TypeScript required for React projects?
faq.typescript4A: Not technically required, but strongly recommended. TypeScript prevents entire categories of runtime errors, makes React prop types explicit, and is supported out of the box by Create React App, Vite, and Next.js.
faq.typescript5Q: What TypeScript configuration does DMC Kreatif use?
faq.typescript5A: We use strict mode with all checks enabled: strictNullChecks, noImplicitAny, noUncheckedIndexedAccess, and exactOptionalPropertyTypes. This catches the maximum number of bugs at compile time.
faq.vite1Q: Why does DMC Kreatif use Vite instead of Webpack?
faq.vite1A: Vite's native ES module development server starts instantly regardless of project size, while Webpack can take 30+ seconds. HMR updates in under 50ms versus Webpack's 1-2 seconds. For production, Vite produces smaller bundles via Rollup.
faq.vite2Q: Is Vite production-ready for enterprise projects?
faq.vite2A: Absolutely. Vite is used by Shopify, Google, Apple, and thousands of production applications. With Rollup under the hood for production builds, it produces highly optimised, battle-tested output.
faq.vite3Q: Can I migrate from Webpack to Vite?
faq.vite3A: Yes — most Webpack projects can migrate to Vite within a few hours. Vite supports most Webpack loader equivalents through its plugin system, and we handle the migration as part of our modernisation service.
faq.vite4Q: Does Vite work with TypeScript and React?
faq.vite4A: Vite has first-class TypeScript and React support with zero configuration. Simply create a .tsx file and it works. Vite uses esbuild for TypeScript transpilation, making it 20-30x faster than the TypeScript compiler.
faq.vite5Q: What is the difference between Vite and Next.js?
faq.vite5A: Vite is a build tool for client-side applications, while Next.js is a full-stack framework with SSR. Use Vite for SPAs, dashboards, and internal tools. Use Next.js when you need SEO, server-side rendering, or API routes.
faq.tailwindcss1Q: Why Tailwind CSS instead of Bootstrap or custom CSS?
faq.tailwindcss1A: Tailwind's utility-first approach produces 80-95% smaller CSS bundles than Bootstrap. Unlike custom CSS, Tailwind enforces consistency through design tokens and eliminates naming conflicts. Every site looks unique, not like a Bootstrap template.
faq.tailwindcss2Q: Does Tailwind CSS affect website performance?
faq.tailwindcss2A: Tailwind actually improves performance. The JIT compiler generates only the CSS classes you use, resulting in production stylesheets under 10KB. Compare this to Bootstrap's 150KB+ or typical custom CSS of 50-200KB.
faq.tailwindcss3Q: Can Tailwind CSS create unique, branded designs?
faq.tailwindcss3A: Absolutely. Our neo-brutalist design system is built entirely with Tailwind CSS. Custom colours, typography, spacing, and animations are defined in the config, ensuring every site has a unique brand identity — not a generic template look.
faq.tailwindcss4Q: Is Tailwind CSS harder to maintain than regular CSS?
faq.tailwindcss4A: It's actually easier. With Tailwind, styles are co-located with components, so you never hunt for CSS files. Refactoring is safer because styles are scoped. And the design token system prevents colour and spacing drift over time.
faq.tailwindcss5Q: Does DMC Kreatif use Tailwind CSS v4?
faq.tailwindcss5A: Yes, we use Tailwind CSS v4 which introduced a new CSS-first configuration, the Oxide engine for faster builds, and automatic content detection. This means even faster build times and a simpler developer experience.
faq.framerMotion1Q: Why use Framer Motion instead of CSS animations?
faq.framerMotion1A: CSS animations can't handle exit animations, layout changes, or gesture-driven interactions. Framer Motion's declarative API makes complex animation sequences simple while maintaining 60fps performance through hardware acceleration.
faq.framerMotion2Q: Do animations slow down website performance?
faq.framerMotion2A: Not when done correctly. Framer Motion uses GPU-accelerated transforms by default, keeping animations off the main thread. Our animation system is optimised for Core Web Vitals — all animations use will-change and composite-only properties.
faq.framerMotion3Q: What types of animations does DMC Kreatif implement?
faq.framerMotion3A: Scroll-triggered reveals, page transitions, hover micro-interactions, staggered list animations, counter animations for statistics, parallax effects, and gesture-driven interfaces. Every animation serves a purpose in the UX.
faq.framerMotion4Q: Can animations be disabled for accessibility?
faq.framerMotion4A: Yes. We implement the prefers-reduced-motion media query across all projects. Users who prefer reduced motion see instant state changes instead of animations, meeting WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.
faq.framerMotion5Q: Is Framer Motion included in all DMC Kreatif projects?
faq.framerMotion5A: Framer Motion is part of our standard stack for all React projects. It's lightweight (just 32KB gzipped), tree-shakeable, and provides the animation capabilities needed for our premium, agency-quality user experiences.
faq.supabase1Q: Why does DMC Kreatif choose Supabase over Firebase?
faq.supabase1A: Supabase uses PostgreSQL (not NoSQL), supports EU hosting for GDPR compliance, offers Row-Level Security, has no vendor lock-in, and provides a more generous free tier. For European businesses, it's the superior choice.
faq.supabase2A: Yes. Supabase offers EU region hosting (Frankfurt, Ireland), Row-Level Security for data isolation, and full data export capabilities. Combined with our GDPR-compliant implementations, your data stays in Europe.
faq.supabase3Q: What can Supabase do for my web application?
faq.supabase3A: Authentication (email, Google, social logins), real-time data synchronisation, file storage with CDN, serverless edge functions, auto-generated APIs, and PostgreSQL database — all from a single platform.
faq.supabase4A: Supabase has a generous free tier (50K monthly active users, 500MB database, 1GB storage). The Pro plan at $25/month covers most business needs. Compare this to Firebase's unpredictable usage-based pricing.
faq.supabase5A: Yes. We use Supabase for custom e-commerce with product catalogues, user accounts, order management, and payment processing via Stripe/LemonSqueezy integration. Row-Level Security ensures secure multi-tenant data access.
faq.vercel1Q: Why does DMC Kreatif deploy on Vercel?
faq.vercel1A: Vercel is created by the Next.js team, ensuring optimal framework support. Its global edge network, automatic CI/CD, preview deployments, and Web Vitals analytics make it the best platform for React and Next.js applications.
faq.vercel2Q: How fast are websites hosted on Vercel?
faq.vercel2A: Vercel's edge network has 100+ points of presence worldwide. Static assets load in under 50ms, and server-rendered pages in under 200ms. Our Vercel-deployed sites consistently achieve sub-1-second Largest Contentful Paint.
faq.vercel3Q: Is Vercel suitable for business-critical websites?
faq.vercel3A: Vercel provides 99.99% uptime SLA on Enterprise plans, DDoS protection, automatic HTTPS, and instant rollbacks. Clients include GitHub, McDonald's, and The Washington Post — it's battle-tested at any scale.
faq.vercel4A: Push to Git and Vercel automatically builds, tests, and deploys. Every branch gets a unique preview URL for stakeholder review. Production deploys are atomic — if a build fails, the previous version stays live.
faq.vercel5Q: What is the cost of hosting on Vercel?
faq.vercel5A: Vercel's Hobby plan is free for personal projects. The Pro plan ($20/month) covers most business sites with unlimited bandwidth and 100GB. Enterprise plans include SLAs, priority support, and advanced analytics.
faq.shopify1Q: Why choose Shopify for European e-commerce?
faq.shopify1A: Shopify supports multi-currency checkout, EU payment gateways (iDEAL, Bancontact, Klarna), VAT handling, and GDPR-compliant data processing. Its 99.99% uptime and PCI compliance eliminate server management entirely.
faq.shopify2Q: Can DMC Kreatif build custom Shopify themes?
faq.shopify2A: Yes. We build both custom Liquid themes for traditional Shopify and Hydrogen-powered headless storefronts with React. Custom themes ensure your store has a unique brand identity, not a generic template look.
faq.shopify3A: Headless Shopify uses the Storefront API to power a custom React frontend while Shopify handles the backend: checkout, payments, inventory, and orders. You get Shopify's reliability with our premium frontend experience.
faq.shopify4Q: What Shopify apps does DMC Kreatif recommend?
faq.shopify4A: We typically integrate Klaviyo (email marketing), Yotpo (reviews), ShipStation (shipping), and Privy (popups). For EU-specific needs: Mollie Payments, Sendcloud, and GDPR compliance apps.
faq.shopify5Q: How long does a Shopify project take?
faq.shopify5A: A custom Shopify theme takes 3-4 weeks. A headless Shopify build with Hydrogen takes 5-8 weeks. Migration from WooCommerce or Magento adds 1-2 weeks for data transfer and SEO redirect mapping.
faq.headlessWp1A: Headless WordPress uses WordPress as a content management system (backend) while a separate React/Next.js application handles the frontend. Content is delivered via API, resulting in 3-5x faster page loads than traditional WordPress.
faq.headlessWp2A: Businesses already using WordPress who want modern performance without retraining content editors. Also ideal for content-heavy sites (blogs, news, magazines) where editorial workflow matters as much as frontend speed.
faq.headlessWp3Q: Do WordPress plugins still work with headless setup?
faq.headlessWp3A: Backend plugins (ACF, Yoast SEO, WPML, WooCommerce) continue working normally. Frontend-only plugins (sliders, page builders) are replaced by custom React components that perform significantly better.
faq.headlessWp4A: The initial build costs 20-30% more due to the dual architecture. However, the long-term savings from better performance (lower hosting costs), fewer security issues, and easier maintenance often offset the upfront investment within 12 months.
faq.headlessWp5Q: How does DMC Kreatif connect WordPress to React?
faq.headlessWp5A: We use WPGraphQL for efficient data fetching with Next.js. Custom post types, ACF fields, and taxonomies are all exposed via the GraphQL API. Incremental Static Regeneration ensures content updates appear within seconds.
faq.postgresql1Q: Why PostgreSQL instead of MySQL or MongoDB?
faq.postgresql1A: PostgreSQL offers JSONB for flexible data, Row-Level Security for GDPR compliance, full-text search without Elasticsearch, and advanced features (CTEs, window functions) that MySQL lacks. It's the most capable open-source database.
faq.postgresql2Q: Is PostgreSQL suitable for small business websites?
faq.postgresql2A: Absolutely. PostgreSQL runs on Supabase's free tier (500MB), which handles thousands of users easily. As your business grows, PostgreSQL scales seamlessly to millions of rows without architecture changes.
faq.postgresql3Q: How does PostgreSQL help with GDPR?
faq.postgresql3A: Row-Level Security (RLS) enforces data access rules at the database level — users can only access their own data, even if application code has vulnerabilities. Combined with EU-hosted Supabase, your data stays GDPR compliant.
faq.postgresql4Q: Can PostgreSQL handle JSON data like MongoDB?
faq.postgresql4A: Yes. PostgreSQL's JSONB type stores, queries, and indexes JSON data efficiently. Unlike MongoDB, you get JSON flexibility with SQL joins, ACID transactions, and relational integrity in a single database.
faq.postgresql5Q: What PostgreSQL extensions does DMC Kreatif use?
faq.postgresql5A: We commonly use pgvector for AI embeddings, PostGIS for geospatial data, pg_trgm for fuzzy search, and uuid-ossp for unique identifiers. Supabase makes enabling extensions a single click.
faq.nodejs1A: Node.js uses JavaScript on the server, enabling full-stack development with a single language. Its event-driven architecture handles thousands of concurrent connections efficiently, making it ideal for real-time APIs and microservices.
faq.nodejs2Q: Is Node.js fast enough for production applications?
faq.nodejs2A: Yes. Node.js runs on Chrome's V8 engine, compiling JavaScript to machine code. Companies like Netflix, LinkedIn, and PayPal use Node.js for their production backends, handling millions of requests per day.
faq.nodejs3Q: What Node.js frameworks does DMC Kreatif use?
faq.nodejs3A: For API development, we use Express.js and Fastify. For serverless functions, we use Vercel Functions and Supabase Edge Functions (Deno). For full-stack applications, Next.js API routes handle backend logic seamlessly.
faq.nodejs4Q: Can Node.js handle e-commerce backend requirements?
faq.nodejs4A: Absolutely. Node.js powers Shopify's backend, handles payment processing via Stripe SDKs, manages inventory systems, and processes thousands of concurrent orders. Its non-blocking I/O is perfect for high-traffic stores.
faq.nodejs5Q: How does Node.js compare to PHP for web development?
faq.nodejs5A: Node.js offers better performance for I/O-intensive tasks, a unified JavaScript stack, modern async/await patterns, and a faster-growing ecosystem. PHP remains viable for WordPress, but Node.js is the modern choice for new projects.
